title: Senate G.O.P. Gambles Its Legacy and Political Fate on Bill
summary: The sprawling legislation that Republicans expended extraordinary effort to muscle through the Senate was a high-stakes risk that is likely to have major consequences for the party and the country.

title: Poorest Americans Would Be Hurt By Trump’s Big Bill
summary: Small improvements in taxes are overshadowed by cuts to health insurance and other federal aid, resulting in a package favoring the wealthy.

title: Paramount to Pay Trump $16 Million to Settle ‘60 Minutes’ Lawsuit
summary: President Trump had sued over an interview with former Vice President Kamala Harris. The company needs federal approval for a multibillion-dollar sale.

title: CBS News President to Depart Amid Network’s Tensions With Trump
summary: Wendy McMahon, the president of CBS News and Stations, had allied herself with Bill Owens, the “60 Minutes” executive producer who recently resigned.

title: Penn Agrees to Limit Participation of Transgender Athletes
summary: In a deal with the Trump administration, the University of Pennsylvania will not allow transgender women to participate in women’s sports.

title: Trump Withholds Nearly $7 Billion for Schools, With Little Explanation
summary: The money, which was allocated by Congress, helps pay for after-school programs, support for students learning English and other services.

title: On Pivotal Day for His Bill, Trump Leaves Washington for ‘Alligator Alcatraz’
summary: President Trump’s visit to the migrant detention center in the Everglades was meant to highlight the issue that binds his party to him more than anything else — immigration.

title: Social Security Backs Off Listing Living Migrants as Dead
summary: Instead, the agency is flagging as “unverified” the Social Security numbers of thousands of people who lost their temporary legal status.

title: Jury in Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Trial Reaches Verdict on All Counts but Racketeering Conspiracy
summary: The jury will keep deliberating on a racketeering conspiracy charge in the morning after saying there were “unpersuadable opinions on both sides.”

title: Kodak, Once the Picture of a Dying Brand, Is Having a Moment
summary: The company’s name has become synonymous with a failure to adapt to the digital revolution. But overseas, its logo has become an unlikely retro fashion statement.

title: Zohran Mamdani Wins N.Y.C. Mayoral Primary in Decisive 12-Point Victory
summary: Mr. Mamdani roundly defeated Andrew M. Cuomo in the Democratic contest, widening his primary-night lead by a significant margin once ranked-choice tabulations were run.

title: New Yorkers Embraced Ranked-Choice Voting. Mamdani’s Win Proves It.
summary: Here are five takeaways from New York City’s second experience with ranked-choice voting, and how it helped Zohran Mamdani secure a decisive victory.

title: Trump Falsely Claims Mamdani Is an Illegal Immigrant and Threatens to Arrest Him
summary: President Trump claimed that the New York mayoral candidate, a naturalized U.S. citizen, was “here illegally,” his latest effort to promote false conspiracy theories about political opponents.

title: Lack of New U.S. Sanctions Allows Russia to Replenish Its War Chest
summary: President Trump has issued no new restrictions on Russia this year, in effect allowing Moscow to acquire the money and materials it needs in its conflict with Ukraine.

title: Trump Pauses Some Weapons Transfers to Ukraine
summary: The White House cited Pentagon concerns that some American arms stockpiles were dwindling too low. Among the affected weapons were air defense systems, bombs, missiles and artillery rounds.

title: Denmark Begins Drafting Women as Russian Threat Looms
summary: The Nordic country for the first time has extended a lottery for compulsory military service to women in its latest move to expand its armed forces.

title: Dalai Lama Tightens Grip on Reins of Succession in the Face of Chinese Pressure
summary: The aging Tibetan spiritual leader is looking to prevent Beijing from taking advantage of a power vacuum that might arise after his death.

title: Dalai Lama Succession: How the Next Tibetan Spiritual Leader Will Be Chosen
summary: The Tibetan spiritual leader may announce a succession plan intended to thwart Chinese interference.

title: Trump Says Israel Agrees to Conditions for Gaza Cease-Fire Proposal
summary: In a social media post, the president said the United States and Israel were finalizing a proposal to Hamas. The announcement comes ahead of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s visit to Washington next week.

title: Ali Shamkhani, Top Iran Official, Survived Israeli Strike
summary: Rear Adm. Ali Shamkhani was seen struggling to walk with a cane at a funeral procession this weekend for military commanders killed in the 12-day war.

title: With CEQA Scaled Back, California Hopes for a Housing Boom
summary: After scaling back a landmark environmental law, Gov. Gavin Newsom and other state leaders are hoping for a construction boom.

title: The Disaster That Just Passed the Senate
summary: Trump’s “big beautiful bill” would gut Medicaid, nutrition assistance and clean energy credits. All for what?

title: China Used to Emulate America. Now the Reverse Is True.
summary: In the great dance between the two rivals, it’s getting harder to tell which of them is leading and which is following.

title: Columbia Will Pay $9 Million to Settle Lawsuit Over U.S. News Ranking
summary: Students said they had been overcharged for their educations as a result of incorrect data that they said the school had used to artificially inflate its ranking.

title: Alabama Violated Constitutional Rights of Death Row Inmate, Appeals Court Rules
summary: A federal appellate panel said that Michael Sockwell was eligible to be retried because prosecutors systematically eliminated Black potential jurors at his 1990 murder trial.

title: The U.S. Sends Lots of Plastic Trash Overseas. Malaysia Just Said No Thanks.
summary: No country receives more discarded plastic from wealthy countries, but shipments from the United States are no longer welcome.

title: Lucy the Pig, a Celebrity on Staten Island, Can Stay at Home for Now
summary: Health officials told Lucy’s owners that she would have to leave the city. After the family, the neighborhood and its political representatives protested, a temporary reprieve emerged.
